title: Lynyrd Skynyrd - Original Discography LAME 3.99.5 - 320Kbps
description:
In 1971, two years before Lynyrd Skynyrd recorded their official LP for MCA Records, the rowdy Florida rockers made a scorching unreleased studio album in Muscle Shoals, Alabama, with Jimmy Johnson and his production crew, "the Swampers." In 1978, 9 tracks from those sessions were released as "Skynyrd's First and ...Last," but now for the first time, here is the complete 17 track Muscle Shoals album. When Skynyrd wrote "Sweet Home Alabama," this album is what they were talking about. This is very RAW Skynyrd.

Free Bird - The Movie: Even though they recorded for only 4 short years, Lynyrd Skynyrd  left behind some of rock 'n' roll's most enduring classics. Go back in time and experience the band's true spirit, raw power and three-guitar attack in blistering live performances, revealing interviews and home movies. Includes 15 live performances. Burn to dvd or watch with VLC media player.

When the album "One More from the Road" came out, it was great. When the first double cd of the same name came out, it was butchered. The 25th Anniversary was remastered AND restored to theoriginal. When I got the restored version, the other went in the trash.

These are my rips.

1973 - Pronounced Leh-Nerd Skin-Nerd (Remastered and Expanded)
1974 - Second Helping (Remastered and Expanded)
1975 - Nuthin' Fancy (Remastered and Expanded)
1976 - Gimme Back My Bullets (Remastered and Expanded)

1998 - Skynyrd's First; The Complete Muscle Shoals Album (Remastered)
